nodes.text: The Sanction was an Imperial-class Star Destroyer that served in the Galactic Empire's navy during the Galactic Civil War. The Star Destroyer took part in the defense of the Trenchenovu shipyards from an anticipated attack by a Rebel Alliance squadron, being loaned a TIE fighter squadron from the Empire's 204th Imperial Fighter Wing. After the 204th's TIEs ambushed the Alliance squadron, the Sanction jumped out of hyperspace to cut off the rebels' escape, the enemy squadron being nearly completely destroyed after.
The Sanction was an Imperial-class Star Destroyer equipped with hyperdrive systems.

During the Galactic Civil War, the Star Destroyer Sanction served in the navy of the Galactic Empire. Around seven months before the Battle of Endor in 4 ABY,  the Empire learned that a Rebel Alliance BTL-A4 Y-wing assault starfighter/bomber squadron was planning an attack on the Trenchenovu shipyards. To set a trap for the rebels, a squadron of twelve TIE fighters were loaned to the Sanction by the Empire's 204th Imperial Fighter Wing to defend Trenchenovu. The 204th's flagship, the Imperial I-class Star Destroyer Pursuer, had been planned to participate, but was forced to divert to a crisis elsewhere.

When the rebel attack came, the 204th TIEs ambushed the rebel Y-wings and drove the bombers from the shipyards. The Sanction, meanwhile, was signalled to jump to the Trenchenovu shipyards through hyperspace. The Star Destroyer's arrival forced the rebel squadron to fly back through the shipyards. The 204th's TIE fighters were able to eliminate all but one of the Y-wings, flown by the squadron leader Nath Tensent, which escaped. Months later, Tensent recalled the battle, including the Sanction's arrival, to Yrica Quell, a pilot working for the New Republic's intelligence.
The Sanction was mentioned in the 2019 novel Alphabet Squadron, written by Alexander Freed.
